title: NUBRAC with his all famous strat..
body:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ykfrX8cY2u8
??? hes doing it again how is he not banned this is so troll

replies.body:
https://www.leagueofgraphs.com/summoner/na/Nubrac

You mean this guy? He's in the top 4.5% of players this season, not to mention ending last season in Grandmaster (top 0.05%). If his strategy sucks so much, and is so troll and useless that he should be banned... you know just saying like... he's doing something right, and just because it's not the same thing that everyone else says you should do doesn't mean it isn't a valid playstyle.

THE GUY ENDED LAST SEASON GRANDMASTER DOING THIS SHIT LET ME SAY THAT AGAIN. What's your peak? Probably mid-high gold like most of us.

But you are also not aware how he got into GM, lets ignore the fact that he got on early S9 lp bullshit climbing with +-55% wr.

He played exclusively, Leona supp(127/111, 53% wr), ap Amumu jngle(306/264, 54% wr) and occasional top/normal supp Teemo.

After getting into master/GM area, meeting all streamers, he came up with "excelent" strat...

Just look at him now. Plat 3(212 games), 49%. Playing mostly normaly. If he gets GM this year, that would mean that he impoved, since last year, he just got on early lp boost from Riot...

PS - he didnt end in GM, but in laughable D3
https://i.ibb.co/Pj8kV6h/nubrac-stats.png

Thats the highest elo he got that season, he ended in D3.

Here you go and there is also where he started this season.

https://imgur.com/P0HAit4

> [{quoted}](name=shunpo script,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=oyeJMpPL,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2020-02-09T10:47:23.184+0000)
>
> https://www.leagueofgraphs.com/summoner/na/Nubrac
> 
> You mean this guy? He's in the top 4.5% of players this season, not to mention ending last season in Grandmaster (top 0.05%). If his strategy sucks so much, and is so troll and useless that he should be banned... you know just saying like... he's doing something right, and just because it's not the same thing that everyone else says you should do doesn't mean it isn't a valid playstyle.
> 
> THE GUY ENDED LAST SEASON GRANDMASTER DOING THIS SHIT LET ME SAY THAT AGAIN. What's your peak? Probably mid-high gold like most of us.

He climbs playing normally (Amumu jg, Leona supp etc.) and then starts playing his troll strats until he lose his elo, then just rinse and repeat.
You can even see the pattern in the link you provied, 2 days ago he was jsut spamming amumu jg http://prntscr.com/qzonfs
And after that he spams teemo http://prntscr.com/qzonl1
... he has a 52% winrate on Teemo this season... Now I'm not some 5head math wizard, but doesn't that mean he's winning more games than he's losing or something like that?
Wait, so you are telling me that "GM" player has 52% wr on his main champ in plat 3 xD

> [{quoted}](name=Jng Account,realm=EUW,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=oyeJMpPL,comment-id=0003000000000000,timestamp=2020-02-09T10:59:00.554+0000)
>
> Wait, so you are telling me that "GM" player has 52% wr on his main champ in plat 3 xD

Random guy here, i have no idea if this guy´s ever actually been GM as no site other than league of graphs state it but what can be confirmed is that he did not actually climb by playing teemo.

He climbed by playing Leona and a couple of jungle tanks.


Then he declined like hell by playing Teemo, and is now stuck in platinum with it which is already embarrassing enough for a supposed Diamond Teemo main.....

the guy's match history is weird.  there are quite a few trolls in his matches and btw, it appears that he decides what character or position he is going to play and then plays only that for the entire day

The highest anyone got placed this season was Plat 1 after 10 matches, and this guy has the name "Nubrac" so I'm betting that people troll the shit out of him all the time, regardless of what he's playing.

Trade accounts and see how high you get when every single match someone recognizes your name and half of those decide to fuck with you because "SOCIETY SAYS DO NOT LIKE THIS PERSON I MUST OBEY OR MY PROGRAMMING WILL FORCE ME TO SELF-DESTRUCT REEEE"

He started in plat 4, what are you talking about? Tops of ladder started much higher.

Is there documanted case where someone trolled him when he played normally?
He plays normally then trolls, what part of that did u not understand?

> [{quoted}](name=Bijeesny,realm=EUNE,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=oyeJMpPL,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2020-02-09T10:51:06.915+0000)
>
> He climbs playing normally (Amumu jg, Leona supp etc.) and then starts playing his troll strats until he lose his elo, then just rinse and repeat.
> You can even see the pattern in the link you provied, 2 days ago he was jsut spamming amumu jg http://prntscr.com/qzonfs
> And after that he spams teemo http://prntscr.com/qzonl1

Lies. He played only 2 games with Leona and lost (100% loss rate). With Amumu he has 23 wins and 20 losses. His main is clearly Teemo - and that's also the champ with highest win rate from his climb list:

https://i.imgur.com/eWyZv8Z.png[]

49 Wins / 45 losses 

How low can you sink - to try to twist the truth - by selecting some random games which don't reflect reality (his overall stats). You reek of jealousy/envy.Same goes for the OP - a Silver who hates on someone from Platinum - someone who might end-up Diamond again - as he did for the last 4 seasons.

I can agree that Nubrac is not the best team mate (especially if you're adc) - but taking the whole LoL community into account - he's somewhere in the middle. Mainly because he tries to win every game (never gives up) - he gives his best - which is not something that can be said about more than half of the community. And that's why he's not banned. He doesn't brake the rules - he simply has some unusual picks - which tend to piss a lot of people who don't follow the usual meta. His roaming play style - is nothing new - that's actually endorsed by players from Challenger who support champs like {{champion:412}},{{champion:35}} ,{{champion:53}} ,{{champion:432}} and so on... Tho, there's a huge gab between an ADC from challenger and ADC's from Diamond 4 and below. Challenger ADCs can do just fin vs 2 bot - while the ones from lower elo tend to struggle without a support (myself included). He's not on a Challenger level either - and that's probably why strategy doesn't work so well (not among the best at it - and plays a role and in a league - where his ADC is usually dependent of support). Still - Riot does not see the meta - as a rule that should be followed -  and thus - they seem to find it hard to ban him for not following the crowd (playing like the majority).

> [{quoted}](name=Xhaiden,realm=EUNE,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=oyeJMpPL,comment-id=000300000001,timestamp=2020-02-09T13:01:21.892+0000)
>
> Lies. He played only 2 games with Leona and lost (100% loss rate). With Amumu he has 23 wins and 20 losses. His main is clearly Teemo - and that's also the champ with highest win rate from his climb list:
> 
> https://i.imgur.com/eWyZv8Z.png[]
> 
> 49 Wins / 45 losses 

I never said he's winning a lot with these champs. I said he's playing them until he climbs to diamond/master. Then from that point he plays his troll strats.

> How low can you sink - to try to twist the truth - by selecting some random games which don't reflect reality (his overall stats). You reek of jealousy/envy.Same goes for the OP - a Silver who hates on someone from Platinum - someone who might end-up Diamond again - as he did for the last 4 seasons.

You would be correct if we were the only one "hating" on Nubrac...
But even the high elo players like Tarzaned, ForestWithin, ICU, Doublelift, Jensen, Alicopter etc. all think what Nubrac does is trolling.
By your logic, these high-profile streamers and pro players are "jealous" of him, a diamond nonamer who needs to troll his teammates to be relevant as a streamer? That kindaaaa makes no sense. 

> I can agree that Nubrac is not the best team mate (especially if you're adc) - but taking the whole LoL community into account - he's somewhere in the middle. Mainly because he tries to win every game (never gives up) - he gives his best - which is not something that can be said about more than half of the community. And that's why he's not banned. He doesn't brake the rules - he simply has some unusual picks - which tend to piss a lot of people who don't follow the usual meta. 

Actually he got 2 week banned last year. And a rioter confirmed on reddit that the ban was justified. it was for the same reason that smite supp singed was banned - he did not communicate with his teammates about his playstyle which created a negative experience both in terms of behaviour and gameplay.
Additionally, rioter also said he only did it when a streamer was in his game.

> His roaming play style - is nothing new - that's actually endorsed by players from Challenger who support champs like {{champion:412}},{{champion:35}} ,{{champion:53}} ,{{champion:432}} and so on... 

Except what he does is not roaming. Idk what he does now, but last year when the whole drama with him and NB3 started, what he did was he would take teemo supp, and then go on top or mid AT THE START OF THE GAME and STAYED FOR A LONGER PERIODS OF TIME IN THAT LANE.
He would not communicate about it with his teammates and even when his teammates BEGGED him to play normally, he refused.

Even Alicopter, a guy who plays roaming alistar support, also agrees that what nubrac does is just trolling.

> Tho, there's a huge gab between an ADC from challenger and ADC's from Diamond 4 and below. Challenger ADCs can do just fin vs 2 bot - while the ones from lower elo tend to struggle without a support (myself included). He's not on a Challenger level either - and that's probably why strategy doesn't work so well (not among the best at it - and plays a role and in a league - where his ADC is usually dependent of support). 

If that was the case we wouldnt see supports being played on bot in challenger xD

> Still - Riot does not see the meta - as a rule that should be followed -  and thus - they seem to find it hard to ban him for not following the crowd (playing like the majority).

As i said, he was 2 week banned for doing that.

Let me correct you with the NB3 thing, he went mid and stayed mid the whole game, never went bot to help adc.

That is literally just throwing the game right there

> [{quoted}](name=Bijeesny,realm=EUNE,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=oyeJMpPL,comment-id=0003000000010001,timestamp=2020-02-09T13:44:32.832+0000)
>
> I never said he's winning a lot with these champs. I said he's playing them until he climbs to diamond/master. Then from that point he plays his troll strats.

And a rioter confirmed on reddit that the ban was justified. it was for the same reason that smite supp singed was banned - he did not communicate with his teammates about his playstyle which created a negative experience both in terms of behaviour and gameplay.
> Additionally, rioter also said he only did it when a streamer was in his game.
> 
> Except what he does is not roaming. Idk what he does now, but last year when the whole drama with him and NB3 started, what he did was he would take teemo supp, and then go on top or mid AT THE START OF THE GAME and STAYED FOR A LONGER PERIODS OF TIME IN THAT LANE.
> He would not communicate about it with his teammates and even when his teammates BEGGED him to play normally, he refused.
> 
> Even Alicopter, a guy who plays roaming alistar support, also agrees that what nubrac does is just trolling.
> 
> If that was the case we wouldnt see supports being played on bot in challenger xD
> 
> As i said, he was 2 week banned for doing that.

You have the screenshot above - he's playing Teemo the most / 2 x more than Amumu and 50 x more than Leona. The FACTS speak for themselves.

> [{quoted}](name=Xhaiden,realm=EUNE,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=oyeJMpPL,comment-id=00030000000100010000,timestamp=2020-02-09T15:22:46.101+0000)
>
> You have the screenshot above - he's playing Teemo the most / 2 x more than Amumu and 50 x more than Leona. The FACTS speak for themselves.

What facts? That he plays those champs? Yea, he PLAYS NORMALLY UNTIL HE REACHES HIGH ELO AND THEN TROLLS. Which part you dont understand?
Even if i was incorrect about champs he plays, my point still stands. He plays seriously until he reaches diamond again, and then uses his troll strats. 
Last year it was """"""roaming"""" teemo, and now it's apparently """""""roaming"""""" garen.

> [{quoted}](name=Bijeesny,realm=EUNE,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=oyeJMpPL,comment-id=0003000000010001,timestamp=2020-02-09T13:44:32.832+0000)
>
> Actually he got 2 week banned last year. And a rioter confirmed on reddit that the ban was justified. it was for the same reason that smite supp singed was banned - he did not communicate with his teammates about his playstyle which created a negative experience both in terms of behaviour and gameplay.

this is not true. at the very least the singed from years ago actually did communicate his strat. 

dont put this idiotic nubrac strat on the same level as support singed.

> [{quoted}](name=Lazy Grandpa,realm=EUW,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=oyeJMpPL,comment-id=00030000000100010001,timestamp=2020-02-09T16:09:18.022+0000)
>
> this is not true. at the very least the singed from years ago actually did communicate his strat. 
> 
> dont put this idiotic nubrac strat on the same level as support singed.

Announcing  ≠ communicating.
All they did was copy paste something that would let their team know they're basically fucked. They did not communicate with their team, they didn't discuss anything either, they simply walked in lobby, announced he was gonna play his way and everyone else would have to adapt to it, if not, then too bad. Ignoring or straight out refusing to change your "strat" even when begged by your team. That is not communicating. And this is exactly what Nubrac does aswell.

Honestly, Riot is probably just "scared" of doing something after all these scandals they have had in the last few months. We know they can't handle PR without ending up offending anyone. Everytime they try to fix a scandal, they create another one for it. Nubrac is basically using loopholes so he's technically "playing legit and not trolling" because he's trying to win and the game doesn't have a set of rules that dictates what champion and where to play them. So Riot can't really just straight ban him without another retaliation scandal and they're avoiding it.

>Lies. He played only 2 games with Leona and lost (100% loss rate). With Amumu he has 23 wins and 20 losses.

Leona/Amumu part clearly pointed towards his S9 stats(569 games with 54% mumu, 238 games with 53% leo).

>His main is clearly Teemo - and that's also the champ with highest win rate from his climb list:

52% on main champ is pretty sad for "GM", rather dia, player in mid plat.

>How low can you sink - to try to twist the truth - by selecting some random games which don't reflect reality (his overall stats).

Over all stats?

Out of his last 100 games, he spent only 34 in support role, 58 games in jngle, 5 mid and 3 top.

He is clearly desperately trying to get higher with same champs he did last season(ap amumu, mundo and rammus).

>He doesn't brake the rules - he simply has some unusual picks - which tend to piss a lot of people who don't follow the usual meta.

Shifting the game so much around your strat is against the rules, unlike picking xy into weird roles or building weird items. These strats(with Signed and Nunu ones) differentiate from what is considered normal too much, thus you have to have your team agreeing with it.

>His roaming play style - is nothing new - that's actually endorsed by players from Challenger who support champs like , , , and so on...

Not of those is endorsing ditching botlane from lvl1 and staying in lane with laners.

>Tho, there's a huge gab between an ADC from challenger and ADC's from Diamond 4 and below. Challenger ADCs can do just fin vs 2 bot - while the ones from lower elo tend to struggle without a support (myself included).

In challanger, you are roaming if you know their jngler is far enough so he won't dive your adc. There is huge gab between challanger and dia, it's not specific to role. Lonely adc from lvl1 will inevitably lose in challanger game.

>and that's probably why strategy doesn't work so well

It doesnt work bcs

1. Your adc, side of the map with drake and tower without fortification is left alone, while either the role that is least important(top) is being supported or role that is dependent on xp(mid) is.
2. It tilts your team, strat that far away from what is considered normal is against rules and I can't really blame players for hating him, after all, I wouldn't like him in my games.

>Still - Riot does not see the meta - as a rule that should be followed - and thus - they seem to find it hard to ban him for not following the crowd (playing like the majority).

Meta is one thing, offmeta is other thing. But strat that shifts whole game around it is whole different lvl and should be bannable.

> [{quoted}](name=Jng Account,realm=EUW,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=oyeJMpPL,comment-id=0003000000010000,timestamp=2020-02-09T13:35:58.168+0000)
>
> Leona/Amumu part clearly pointed towards his S9 stats(569 games with 54% mumu, 238 games with 53% leo).
> 
> 52% on main champ is pretty sad for "GM", rather dia, player in mid plat.
> 
> Over all stats?
> 
> Out of his last 100 games, he spent only 34 in support role, 58 games in jngle, 5 mid and 3 top.
> 
> He is clearly desperately trying to get higher with same champs he did last season(ap amumu, mundo and rammus).
> 
> Shifting the game so much around your strat is against the rules, unlike picking xy into weird roles or building weird items. These strats(with Signed and Nunu ones) differentiate from what is considered normal too much, thus you have to have your team agreeing with it.
> 
> Not of those is endorsing ditching botlane from lvl1 and staying in lane with laners.
> 
> In challanger, you are roaming if you know their jngler is far enough so he won't dive your adc. There is huge gab between challanger and dia, it's not specific to role. Lonely adc from lvl1 will inevitably lose in challanger game.
> 
> It doesnt work bcs
> 
> 1. Your adc, side of the map with drake and tower without fortification is left alone, while either the role that is least important(top) is being supported or role that is dependent on xp(mid) is.
> 2. It tilts your team, strat that far away from what is considered normal is against rules and I can't really blame players for hating him, after all, I wouldn't like him in my games.
> 
> Meta is one thing, offmeta is other thing. But strat that shifts whole game around it is whole different lvl and should be bannable.

Dude, you have a screenshot with the overall statistic above! He has 2 lost games with Leona and with Amumu is not doing any better. Bot the highest win rate and play rate is with Teemo! Check that actual stats - before going with some lie that fits "what you wanna believe". I took the FACTS/Statistic in consideration - not lies meant to fuel the hate for someone who does things differently.

Clearly you'd rather go with a lie then the true/facts - if they don't fit your agenda/beliefs.

> [{quoted}](name=Xhaiden,realm=EUNE,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=oyeJMpPL,comment-id=00030000000100000000,timestamp=2020-02-09T14:58:36.929+0000)
>
> Dude, you have a screenshot with the overall statistic above! He has 2 lost games with Leona and with Amumu is not doing any better. Bot the highest win rate and play rate is with Teemo! Check that actual stats - before going with some lie that fits "what you wanna believe". I took the FACTS/Statistic in consideration - not lies meant to fuel the hate for someone who does things differently.
> 
> Clearly you'd rather go with a lie then the true/facts - if they don't fit your agenda/beliefs.

What? Just click on season 9 tab on op.gg, he abused the hell out of AP Amumu, Leona, Rammus, Mundo and normal Teemo to get into high elo, then he tanked his mmr with his shitty strat.

Notice how he also avereges 100 cs on Teemo. Which indicates than not all games were played as support, but rather normally.

You can also go through his last 100 games. 58 of them was played in jngle, 8 outside of support role. He is **trying** to do the same thing as last year, but this time, system isn't giving him 35 lp on win and -5 on lose, he wont surpass mid dia this season without duoing and playing seriously

I lied about nothing. If I you think so, point it out please.

and in his U.gg , he has over 800 teemo games played in season 9, equal to his total games in leona and amumu, actually in excess

jungle creeps and wave clearing and last hitting also count to average CS.  Most supports lack sufficient wave clear to do so.  Teemo can waveclear...  his average for the support strat is roughly 50 CS  https://u.gg/lol/profile/na1/nubrac/overview?season=12&queueType=ranked_solo_5x5&role=support

he does that with every champion actually.  He picks what he wants to play for the day and then plays according to that

he has multiple rows of this stuff where he'll play many games in whatever manner he had decided

amumu, teemo, actual supports.  He plays whatever it is so long as he's not autofilled and his two primary positions are jungler and support, the least played roles in the game, so he is going to end up with lots of games on them

> [{quoted}](name=shunpo script,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=oyeJMpPL,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2020-02-09T10:47:23.184+0000)
>
> https://www.leagueofgraphs.com/summoner/na/Nubrac
> 
> You mean this guy? He's in the top 4.5% of players this season, not to mention ending last season in Grandmaster (top 0.05%). If his strategy sucks so much, and is so troll and useless that he should be banned... you know just saying like... he's doing something right, and just because it's not the same thing that everyone else says you should do doesn't mean it isn't a valid playstyle.
> 
> THE GUY ENDED LAST SEASON GRANDMASTER DOING THIS SHIT LET ME SAY THAT AGAIN. What's your peak? Probably mid-high gold like most of us.

I checked the guy on several sites and according to just about everyone aside from league of graphs Nubrac ended last season in diamond 3.

He had 50% winrate on Teemo back then, his actual winning picks were Rammus, Leonna and Amumu. 

Right now?  Guy is in platinum 3, has been stuck there for at least 3 weeks since last i checked and he has a 52% winrate on his by far most played Teemo.


How is this guy all that good again? Sure he is high plati which is a thing......but 52% winrate on his main there after having been diamond 3 last season? 

Someone is not quite in form anymore it seems.

> [{quoted}](name=shunpo script,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=oyeJMpPL,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2020-02-09T10:47:23.184+0000)
>
> https://www.leagueofgraphs.com/summoner/na/Nubrac
> 
> You mean this guy? He's in the top 4.5% of players this season, not to mention ending last season in Grandmaster (top 0.05%). If his strategy sucks so much, and is so troll and useless that he should be banned... you know just saying like... he's doing something right, and just because it's not the same thing that everyone else says you should do doesn't mean it isn't a valid playstyle.
> 
> THE GUY ENDED LAST SEASON GRANDMASTER DOING THIS SHIT LET ME SAY THAT AGAIN. What's your peak? Probably mid-high gold like most of us.

Well shit dude I guess once I hit challenger I can int my games since I'm high elo :DDDD

I wish I could tell you what I really thought but I'd get banned for it so I'll just say this. 

25%

Riot has to be consistent with their policy. If they banned people for playing 'off-meta', half of the playerbase would be gone. They can't just ban this guy when he isn't technically breaking the rules, even if you don't like him personally.

He does break the rules tho. Shifting the game so much around your strat is against the rules, unlike picking xy into weird roles or building weird items. These strats(with Signed and Nunu ones) differentiate from what is considered normal too much, thus you have to have your team agreeing with it.

And lets not get into why this strat is dog shit, its whole different story.

I hope he gets banned again, I dont even know why he is doing that, it might in short terms boost his views, but he will ultimately land on 30 viewers again, simply bcs he offers nothing other than "I'm that troll guy, who still needs to climb with normal picks, just to troll afterwards"...
The sad truth is league doesnt have a way to be played. The meta is decided by the players not the developers
Nope, balanced by riot wanting to make LCS "better"

> [{quoted}](name=RyzeRework,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=oyeJMpPL,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2020-02-09T09:02:14.836+0000)
>
> The sad truth is league doesnt have a way to be played. The meta is decided by the players not the developers

And the players in his match didn't like what he was doing and decided to report him. Sounds to me like your logic leads to a system of "all 4 team mates reported you, so you're banned"

> [{quoted}](name=Jng Account,realm=EUW,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=oyeJMpPL,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2020-02-09T08:53:18.055+0000)

No, its not. He was never banned for roaming teemo support, and playing something that "shifts the game around your strat" is not against the rules. If it was, playing kog maw would be bannable.

The singed and nunu bans were also overturned. Riot even stated publicly they were in the wrong.

> [{quoted}](name=Pika Fox,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=oyeJMpPL,comment-id=000000000002,timestamp=2020-02-09T17:30:16.503+0000)
>

He did get banned for doing this.

> [{quoted}](name=Bijeesny,realm=EUNE,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=oyeJMpPL,comment-id=0000000000020001,timestamp=2020-02-09T22:54:44.740+0000)
>
> He did get banned for doing this.

No he did not. Riot even EXPLICITLY STATED he did not get banned for doing so, and EXPLICITLY STATED doing so is not banable. He got banned for "griefing streamers", which was completely BS as literally everyone in high ELO is a streamer. You cant "target a select group of people" when everyone is said select group. Hell, im a streamer.

No to mention that because of the nature of his ban, the method in place that was used to get him banned was discontinued. That should tell you something about the unjust nature of his ban when riot scuttled the backdoor method altogether.

> [{quoted}](name=Pika Fox,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=oyeJMpPL,comment-id=00000000000200010000,timestamp=2020-02-10T08:00:42.875+0000)
>
> No he did not. Riot even EXPLICITLY STATED he did not get banned for doing so, and EXPLICITLY STATED doing so is not banable. He got banned for "griefing streamers", which was completely BS as literally everyone in high ELO is a streamer. You cant "target a select group of people" when everyone is said select group. Hell, im a streamer.

> [{quoted}](name=Pachyderm,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=oyeJMpPL,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2020-02-09T08:45:30.270+0000)

This isn't "off-meta". He's hijacking a role because he wants a reaction.

He isn't hijacking a role though.  He has never stolen cs as a support and he does what a support is meant to do which is a number of things including zoning, warding/sweeping, cc, and utility.  Support isn't the ADC's slave.  There have been many games where I abandon my ADC as a support because someone else on my team is more worth my time.

Here is one such game that I left my ADC to support someone else.  Do I deserve reports because I didn't play the game how other people intend it to be played and tilted my ADC in the process?   https://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/3287863041/209287161?tab=overview 

I agree, it is a really dumb strategy with Garen but his normal Teemo one actually makes sense.  I have been playing Teemo top taking spellthief after my liandry's and boots and it works great.  Teemo as a champion works better when you aren't locked into one position.  The more you can roam the more places you can shroom and not being in top with him saves his shrooms from having to be used to clear.
